Description: Landscape with the Rest on the Flight into Egypt; the group seated on the bank of a stream in the foreground at r, an angel kneeling nearby, the donkey at l, part of a classical building visible amid trees beyond, further trees on the bank at r, a bridge of many arches in the mid-distance and a rocky peak in the distance. 1663 Graphite and grey wash, with black chalk and brown ink
Curator's comments: This drawing relates to the painting of the Landscape with the Rest on the Flight to Egypt that Claude produced in 1661 for van Hamale (for which see Roethlisberger 1962, no. 257) and which is recorded in the Liber Veritatis at No. 154 (for which see 1957,1214.160). It is one of a number of drawings related to this painting (for another see 1895,0915.901. The present drawing records the translation of the composition into an upright format. It is notable for its poetic character which was in part achieved through the gentle use of black chalk and grey wash. The figures are marked in with precision, with minimal revisions in the contours. Lit.: A.M. Hind, 'Catalogue of the Drawings of Claude Lorrain preserved in the Department of Prints and Drawings', London, 1926, no. 268; M.
